content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
This game is a sort of arcade–platform puzzle game with elements of action and even a bit of resource management. Here’s a breakdown of what it’s about and how you might approach it:

1. Game Genre and Feel:
 • It’s similar to classic platformers (think Spelunky-style games) where you navigate a maze–like level.
 • You have an avatar who can move, use a weapon (the sword, here represented as a pickaxe) and interact with various items.
 • The environment is made up of walls, dirt blocks, and other terrain elements that you may be able to “break” or maneuver around.

2. Core Mechanics:
 • Movement and Interaction: You control an avatar that moves around the level, collecting resources and fighting enemies.
 • Using the Sword: The sword is a flickering, single–use tool that can “kill” certain sprites on impact (for example, breaking dirt when swung at it).
 • Resource Collection: Diamonds are the main collectible resource. Gathering them increases your score.
 • Environmental Hazards: Boulders act like falling missiles. They move (fall) downward, so you need to avoid being hit—especially from above—as that can hurt you (or even cause your death, with a possible score penalty).
 • Enemies and NPCs: There are several enemy types—a random mover (enemy), a crab, and a butterfly. Their interactions can even transform enemies into extra diamonds if you can set them off (for example, a collision between butterfly and crab transforms the crab into a diamond with a score bonus).
 • Doors and Exits: An exit door is present that plays a key role in ending the level. Its special interaction checks if you meet a certain diamond–pickup threshold.

3. Objective and Win/Lose Conditions:
 • The goal is to safely navigate the level while collecting resources (diamonds) and avoiding or dealing with hazards (boulders, enemies).
 • You must likely collect a sufficient number of diamonds—note that the exit door only “activates” (or “opens”) when the avatar interacts with it and has more than a certain limit (over 9 diamonds). In other words, you’re rewarded for thorough exploration and resource collection.
 • Losing happens if your avatar gets killed (sprite counter for avatar hits 0).
 • Winning is achieved by triggering the exit mechanism—the game wins when the exit door is removed (sprite counter for exitdoor becomes 0), implying you have successfully met the conditions to leave the level.

4. Overall Strategy Suggestions:
 • Explore methodically: Carefully navigate through the maze–like level, checking corners for diamonds and other hidden resources.
 • Resource management: Make sure you collect enough diamonds (aim for at least 10) so that when you reach the exit door, its interaction (which checks your diamond count) allows you to finish the level.
 • Timing and positioning: Watch out for falling boulders. Stay aware of your vertical position relative to hazards so that you can avoid being crushed—or if possible, position yourself in a way that might let you “kill” a boulder if it comes from a particular angle.
 • Use your sword wisely: Since the sword is limited and flickers (meaning it might be temporary or have a cooldown), save it for breaking up obstacles like dirt or for taking out an enemy when necessary.
 • Manipulate enemy interactions: Look for opportunities to let butterflies and crabs interact. If a butterfly touches a crab, the crab transforms into a diamond—this might be a clever way to gain extra resources if you’re short on points.
 • Plan your exit: Only approach the exit door once you’re sure you’ve collected the needed diamonds. Since the door “kills if the other has more” (i.e. it checks your diamond count), timing your approach correctly is key, and you might want to ensure you’re not in danger from other hazards while making your final dash.
 
In summary, the game challenges you to balance exploration, resource management, and precise action. By planning your path, watching out for dynamic hazards like falling boulders, and even using enemy interactions to your advantage, you can meet the requirements for exiting the level and winning the game.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'
sword -> 'd'

Action:2

I'm moving left from my current position (7,10) to explore the open pathway toward potential diamonds, expecting that this directional command will allow me to progress along an unobstructed route.
